snippet: Amiri Baraka, the former poet laureate of New Jersey, says the 1967 riots were “like a reckoning.”
abstract: Newark Journal; Amiri Baraka, former poet laureate of New Jersey, looks back on the 1967 Newark riots, which lasted nearly a week and left 26 people dead and more than 1,000 injured, including Baraka himself; poet has become a celebrity in the decades since, and is a featured guest at an upcoming four-day poetry festival in Newark that organizers claim is the largest such festival in North America.
lead_paragraph: Amiri Baraka, the former poet laureate of New Jersey, says the 1967 riots were “like a reckoning.”

headline.seo: Amiri Baraka, Newark Poet, Looks Back on a Bloody Week in 1967
headline.main: A Poet Looks Back on a Bloody Week in 1967
headline.print_headline: A Poet Looks Back On a Bloody Week in 1967
